    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Gashadokuro</h1>The dreaded gashadokuro is an undead haunter of the night, a giant skeleton that rises from the earth in the aftermath of a mass starvation event and seeks to inflict its unending hunger on the living.<br /><br /> A gashadokuro that comes about due to a poor growing season is more prone to stalk remote village farmlands at night, while a gashadokuro that arose from the victims of a government-instigated food shortage has few compunctions about stomping straight into bustling cities in broad daylight. These latter gashadokuro even seem to target aristocrats and government authorities—whether or not they are the same politicians whose negligence resulted in the famine in the first place—leading many to believe that the gashadokuro seeks to slake its thirst for revenge even more than it seeks to sate its unending hunger.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Undead</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 33<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=474">Gashadokuro</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 13</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Gashadokuro.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Gashadokuro.png"></a><span alt="Uncommon Trait" class="traituncommon" title="Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can’t be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=159">Uncommon</a></span><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Huge" class="traitsize" title="Huge">Huge</span><span alt="Undead Trait" class="trait" title="Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don’t benefit from healing effects."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160">Undead</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq0204d?Pathfinder-Adventure-Path-148-Fires-of-the-Haunted-City" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 84</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +24; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>; can't speak any language<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +27, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +24<br /><b>Str</b> +8, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +5, <b>Int</b> -3, <b>Wis</b> +3, <b>Cha</b> +3<hr /><b>AC</b> 33, <b>Fort</b> +26, <b>Ref</b> +21, <b>Will</b> +24<br /><b>HP</b> 230 (negative healing); <b>Immunities</b> death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious; <b>Resistances</b>  cold 10, electricity 10, fire 10, piercing 10, slashing 10 <br /><b>Starvation Aura</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=48">divine</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) 60 feet. Any creature that ends its turn in the aura feels the intense pain of starvation and must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude save. On a failure, the creature becomes fatigued and takes 6d6 damage. Damage and fatigue a creature takes from this aura can’t be healed until the affected creature has eaten a full meal.<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> jaws +27 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d12+14 piercing plus Grab</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +27 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 15 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 3d8+14 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Breath Weapon</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) The gashadokuro breathes a spray of bone shards in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area takes 8d12 piercing damage (DC 34 basic Reflex save). It can’t use Breath Weapon again for 1d4 rounds.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Corpse Consumption</b> (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=48"><u>divine</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=117"><u>necromancy</a></u>) If the gashadokuro kills a creature with Swallow Whole, it immediately regains Hit Points equal to the swallowed creature’s level. As long as the gashadokuro still exists, creatures consumed in this way can’t be resurrected except by <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Spells.aspx?ID=377"><i>wish</i></a> or a similarly powerful effect.</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Swallow Whole</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=15"><u>attack</a></u>) Large, 3d6+8 bludgeoning, Rupture 24</span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Nocturnal Terrors</h3>The gashadokuro hunts for victims mainly after dusk, especially in the hour just after midnight. In parts of Tian Xia, particularly in the tumultuous regions of war and famine following the collapse of Imperial Lung Wa, parents hush their hungry children to sleep by warning that nighttime cravings will cause a gashadokuro to visit the household.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
